author: Ian S
comment: I can't get it to connect to fitbit. I just get a long error message and no indication that it's being worked on. Is this app still supported? I love this idea but no one has followed through well on it yet. Please fix soon, thanks!

author: Jake Hennett
comment: Great concept, but poor execution. The app crashes frequently, notifications seem to appear multiple times for the same thing, and the interface feels clunky. The "tutorial" explains very little about the game, and I had to visit the kickstarter page to get a description of the different stats. Energy drains absurdly fast, such that your bot runs out of energy if left alone for even 5 minutes. Perhaps this is part of the game design, but it doesn't make for a great experience. I love the idea of this game, but I don't enjoy the app as it exists currently.

author: Michelle P
comment: Crashes a lot, freezes up my smartwatch (moto 360 1st gen) and doesn't count my steps. I don't totally understand how to use it. Shouldn't it just be like a pedometer. I wanted the cat, it gave me the cat but then reset it when I opened it on my watch to the Android guy...
title: Crashes a lot

comment: Seems very interesting, but the setup does not seem to be working right now. Was this abandoned?
title: Setup is broken

author: Timothy Weaver
comment: I want to like this, that's why I supported the kickstarter campaign. But when I try to connect my fitbit I get an error page.

author: Evita Stenqvist
comment: Slightly lacking functionality wise, yet then again nice and simple. Kills ny battery sadly :/
title: I really like the idea!

author: tristyn tomey
comment: I have made multiple attempts to sign into my fitbit account and it won't load the sign in page. I've tried over wifi and cellular data- still isn't working. Will re-rate once bugs fixed
title: Won't allow sign in

author: Ruthie Bowles
comment: Great idea, but I get an error screen when I try to connect my fitbit. Please fix it, and I will try this app again. It looks great! I want to play!

author: Meta Tiger
comment: Login with Fitbit button just brings me to a blank screen box.  That's it.  Uninstalling sadly.
title: Login with Fitbit no go

author: Tigers Moondiva
comment: Doesn't work for Fitbit - You get a link to a website that's not there when trying to connect

author: Glenn Maiden
comment: need update new firmware. not work with sync to fitbit blaze as well. it kept error.

author: Pankit Kotecha
comment: Motivates you to walk a little more everyday!
I get an error message every time I try to sync with Fitbit. And when I try to send the error message to developers I get another error message. Wasted 20 minutes on it.

reply.author: GPOP Labs
reply.content:
Sorry to hear that you are having issues with StepBOT. As of version 1.03, the FitBit login issue has been resolved; you should be able to login with your FitBit account. Please let us know if you have any other issues with StepBOT. 

Thank you!

title: Won't sync with Fitbit.

author: Roland Verlangen
comment: Thanks for the quick fixes! These guys actually care about their product!
title: They really listen to feedback!

author: K Ram
comment: i really wanted to like this game, but i got an error message whenever i tapped to connect my fitbit. had to uninstall it :(
title: just let me connect my fitbit!

author: Alex Henry
comment: App had such potential, but after wrestling with the clunky ui and having my character reset twice(losing all progress), I just couldn't deal with it any more.  Also, I'm not sure if it's my phone or this app but it's really frustrating when you go on a 4 mile run and you get back expecting lots of experience to give your bot and find the app only recorded 200 steps.  Again that could be a fault of my phone but it seems that my moto 360 caught all of my steps, so I dunno what happened here
title: Just not what I hoped for

author: Stephen Ferguson
comment: I can't figure out this game and there isn't a help feature I can find.
title: Loose energy too fast
